title: Boards are an abject failure
body: This place is all but dead. Riot, why not just admit that turning the forums into le reddit has been a resounding failure and go back to the old format?

replies.body: The boards aren't dead I check the boards everyday to see if I can help someone or to stop trolls or racism and there are about 30 news post each day roughly.

what does being Asian have to do with looking at the boards?
 and no I'm not Asian.
Lol, White Knight XD lmao, I'd rather a troll than put up with a white knight. PC has gone too far.

My name is Adrian Jenkins I'm currently 16 years old, I live in Murray Bridge, South Australia. I primarily use English and I have a slight knowledge of the main Asian language of Mandarin which I learnt in year 9 at the Murray Bridge High School. I'm currently also learning Korean.

But I'm not Asian and I have nothing against being Asian. In fact I would rather be Asian because I know that unlike in Australia I would not of been given life of a platter and I would of actually had to of worked to where I'm now but instead I have way to much spare time I'm a lazy little prick and I don't care about life because I think way to often of why we live life and why we shouldn't. But, if I was in an Asian economy I would have actually something to show for where I am instead of just having a certificate II in Carpentry and Construction and a White Card.

          Mandarin definitely isn't the main language of Asia... It's just the majority spoken language, it's like saying Spanish is the main language of America/Europe due to the crowding in Mexico/Spain

          If anything, (There really isn't a main language IMO) the main language would be Japanese (I'm biased though because it's the language I'm learning), as I'd bet more people know about the word Kawaii than Kě'ài.

         Literally, ask "what is Asia" in the internet and find the most stereotypical answer to be 

        "Kawaii desu Anime, body pillows, otaku, tentacles, Hentai, rice (Okay this is most of Asia but still), sushi, etc. What else would you expect baka."

         For the same reason, you'd get: 

        "tea, biscuits, and the queen" rather than 'tacos' when asking for a stereotypical interpretation of Europe.

PS. I'm Asian, and make fun of my own race with my friends when the situation calls for it.

If I can make sense of it and it isn't racist of offensive I will up vote it.
